MR3 Master Class Bracket 1

By Monster Fenrick on Wednesday, July 10, 2002 - 07:26 am:

This Monday (July 15th) the MR3 Master Class 4X4 Bracket 1 will take place at the following times:
TIMES:
5pm Pacific, 6pm Mountain, 7pm Central, 8pm Eastern 11:30pm London (June 11th 8am Singapore, June 10th Noon for Syndey Australia)

The Contestants! (Name - Species - Trainer)

Sofia - ( Usazo , from ToreyLuvullo )
Reilly - ( Kururin , from TheCampster30 )
Halo - ( Angel , from ShadowFusion )
Pokylyps - ( Golem , from DeadBuffallo )


The Chat location is the Delphi chatroom at http://monster-rancher-metropolis.com
You can get there by entering The Master Rancher's Lodge #47 from the front. Wagering is strictly prohibited.


Once you have logged in, Click on the 4X4 Monster Madness.

Some guidelines:
All visitors MUST be at least 13 years old.
All visitors are asked to please cease chatting while the actual fight is being broadcast by Monster Fenrick!
Other chat/board rules are to be observed, read the Lodge's Chat FAQ for details.

We hope everyone can attend! This particular chat is pretty good and responsive, the downside is that some people with older systems may have troubles with it. It's the only workable chat that could handle such a large crowd for us. It does require you to register with Delphi 24 hours prior to entering.


SEE MONSTERS AT:
www.legendcup.com
- Click "TOURNAMENTS"
- Scroll down and Click "MR3 / Master Class #1"
- Click monster Name for Picture

By Monster Fenrick on Thursday, July 11, 2002 - 05:03 am:

Apocolyps Now?

By Deadbuffalo on Thursday, July 11, 2002 - 05:50 am:

Deadbuffalo's Divination

In slot one we have a very thin Sofia who has proven to be 2nd best in torey's collection of obscenely strong monsters. I wouldn't sacrafice any goats in praise of her yet though, as while she is maxed, 2 of her higher damage techs are stuck in the long range slot, as well as having a level 1 lick, which will either burn Sofia's guts trying it, or her enemy's guts if it connects. Sofia is a good monster, and will prove to be a tough opponent, but the skies do not foretell her victory.

In slot two we have Reily. Campster's tech choice for Reily seems to follow the strategy "its gunna hurt if it hits". The accuracies on Aim boom and Do Mi So are not too high, but the damage is there. Bowling strays from that pattern by having high accuracy along with high damage. Aim hit provides low damage at a low cost, but that might hinder Reily's chances rather than help them. Reily is a monster who the crystal ball remains blurry for; I'd say he has a good shot at winning. Don't kill the goat yet, but you can start finding the fatest ones of the herd.

In slot three we have Halo, champion of the Pixies. I've tried to imagine Halo winning, but I can't see her making it; even with an additional 549 power. The techs are just not there. Raycast does too little damage as do star light and fairy dust (for its guts cost). However, Halo is still the champion of the pixies and should be honored. But the fates work in mysterious ways. Halo may emerge from the dust alive and victorious.

In the fourth and final slot, we have Pokylyps. His stone body may be a solid defense, but it could also be a solid weakness, especially against opponents with lower accuracy techs. His techs are almost all very high damage. However it is unlikely we will see more than 1 olega meteor or tornado punch per match, with golem's slow guts regen. Rock slide will be Pokylyps's dominant attack, being a lower guts cost tech and in the only tech in the middle slot. Whether it will be effective has yet to be determined. I will now toot my own horn. Pokylyps will win. His stone body will crash down upon his enemies and grind their nauseatingly cute bones to a fine dust. And if he loses.... The wrath of his master will be far worse.

There are going to be some superb fights, I'll see you there on Monday.

By torey luvullo on Thursday, July 11, 2002 - 09:23 am:

By torey luvullo on Friday, July 12, 2002 - 06:51 am:

TOREY'S MORNING LINE


Wow! This is going to be a great tournament. Three maxxed monsters, and one very good one, make for some interesting battles. Here's a second opinion.

MonsterBreedTrainerOdds
PokylypsGolemDeadbuffalo9-5
ReillyKuririnCampster5-2
SofiaUsazotoreyluvullo5-2
HaloAngelShadowFusion5-1


I had no idea that Pokylyps had gotten so strong! Looking at him now, his techs are going to be more infrequent, but hit much harder than the others. I had assumed that my favorite would be either Reilly or Sofia, based on discussions I've had with the campster. But both of these monsters have some troubles - Sofia is emaciated, and Reilly has a short-range weakness...obviously, a win from either would not be an upset, but i think the golem is slightly more logical in this spot. As for Halo, she is the one nonmaxxed monster, with only 450 pow. This does not have any effect against the Superior Suzurin and Sizzling Suezo, whose entire repetoires are int. However, the Gruesome Golem is another matter...in this unclear tourney, the most likely event is that Pokylyps gets to beat Halo. So, you take that one loss, and then add in the fact that her techs are somewhat undeveloped, and i think the Petulant Pixie is a longshot.

This is gonna be so much fun!
